name: Harley Dree
text: Doug is fantastic! Amazing customer service. Clean organized shop. Even some Musical instruments to browse. 2 story shopping experience. 12 range lanes. $15 per shooter. Military discount is wonderful! Pleasant stop.

name: Benjy Abbott
text: Great place to go.  Staff was very helpful.  I brought a guy to shoot on the range that had never held a gun before in his life as he is not from America, and after filling out the paper work, we went into the range and went over proper safety for gun handling and firing and this young man had the time of his life putting Freedom Pills down range.  I’d recommend this place to anyone.  Thank You!

name: Joshua Harper
text: I did not buy anything, other than some range time. The price was fair.  I used the indoor pistol range. I enjoyed getting some group therapy. Very well maintained place. I'd recommend this place, to anyone.

name: Paul Carr
text: AAA Pawn Shop & Jewelry have compassion, and are realistic in their appraisal of the item or items you need to sell or pawn.  I had four handguns I needed to sell and had gone to another Decatur Pawn.  The four handguns on the very, very, low side would have been $1,000.00.  The pawn shop that was not AAA offered me $495.00.  I didn't know what to say, just turned around and walked out!!!  AAA Pawn & Jewelry is your place to go for Holiday 2020 jewelry, watches, and especially diamond purchases.  Great selection of quality diamonds.  Christmas, engagement, anniversary, birthday, graduation, I goofed up, etc.  Their diamond case has the quality and price that will make you wish you had shopped there, had you not.

name: Me Me
text: In a very shady part of town in a run down building.  Very sketchy

name: Melissa Collins
text: I came in to sell my wedding set and I had the best possible experience!! They are so kind and made me feel so welcome. I got a great deal and I will definitely do more business with them!!

name: Kira Pickron
text: Have done business with them many, many times. Always gives us a good price for our stuff and very kind and considerate. They definitely care about their customers and if you're late on paying off your pawn, they will work with you and are extremely understanding. Very picky about pawn shops and only have 2 that I'll actually do business with, them being number 1

name: Terri L Sherrill
text: I may sometimes browse other shops. However if I am ready to do business AAA Pawn is where I always go. Its where I feel most comfortable. It's like you have known them forever and doing business with old friends.

name: K L
text: Always great service and people are always friendly. I would definitely recommend to anyone. They are fair and give you the best prices in the area.

resp.text: Thank you so much. We appreciate your business.

name: Adam Lawrence
text:
Bought a Xbox One here for $150, a few days later it died while the person I gifted it to was playing it. I took it back up here and they said they would attempt to get someone to repair it. A few weeks later they said they tried multiple places, each one could not repair the Xbox One. They apparently could not get a video out signal, despite me telling them to wait 20-30 minutes for the included error code. I could reproduce this issue every time. I got a $100 refund and got to keep the Xbox One. That is very generous of them, and I thank them for that. However, I was given a power supply with no screws, it was held together with tape, and it seems like it's missing components, as seen by the empty pin header in the photo. I was going to attempt repair myself, but I no longer have a working power supply, as when I did when I dropped it off to be fixed. This may be the fault of whoever they took it to in order to get it repaired, but everything should have been independently tested after each repair attempt IMO. I just bought a new One S bundle after two failed Ones, this one being the second.

Edit: After a trip back up here, they replaced the power supply, no questions asked. They might make mistakes, sometimes no fault of their own, but they do try to make it right. 👍

The PS3 I bought for $75 is thankfully another story. Its working perfectly after a cleaning and replacing the thermal pads and paste.

name: Lamarrius Peterson
text: they have the best deals on game consoles their the best

name: Brandon Bone
text: Great personal service. Family owned I believe. If you support small business these are the type of people who deserve your patronage. If they can they will help you get the most,  or give you the most, they will. It's just their attitude. It's what all business should be like. If they have 3 copies of a game, they will give you the best copy first, not the other way around. That's the type of treatment you should demand and expect anywhere in America! Most businesses in America,  (Good or bad) should compare themselves, and adopt this type quality of customer service from top to bottom. Rarely do stores prove so effective.

text: Novice to the gun world and they were not only helpful but patient with my many questions. Highly recommended!

name: Candy Eck
text: This is the best Gun & Pawn Shop in Baldwin County. Staff are awesome! I dealt with Stephanie the first time my husband and I came in, and she was great! Robbie helped us while looking at guns. Never dealt that day with the other lady (Christina), but called her the next day and asked her opinion on a firearm, and she was very helpful and knowledgeable! We will definitely be going back and support this business!

name: Wes Flirt
text: Have done business with Rick and staff for years and will continue as long as they are around nice friendly people

name: paulvsalas
text: Rick's place sounds like a good place to do some trading.

name: Kendra Parker
text: Love the place. Can always find something different.  They are reasonably priced and will negotiate with you on guns. The staff is friendly and helpful.  Like the fact it is a family owned business.

name: Austin Lassitter
text: Best prices! Around and are honest. They don't try and get over on their customers like most these pawn shops around here.

name: Katrina LeFaye
text:
This is my favorite place for Guns. They have a wide selection and even usually 22 LR when no one else does. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

My one comment is this is a business and like all businesses they need to make money to keep the lights on and pay their own bills. Don't gripe about their prices as other pawn stores across the country have much higher mark ups.

name: Kendra Phillips
text: This was our second trip to Rick's during family vacations.  We always find something 'we can't live without'!  The staff is very friendly.  They have a variety of hand guns as well as shotguns.  We will continue to stop in anytime we are in the area.

name: kristina miller
text: Friendly and helpful. Give a deal without asking.

name: Vincent Carver
text: Rick's gun and pawn is an awesome place to do business, the staff is very helpful and I would recommend this pawn shop to everyone.

name: Peyton Lewis
text: All the staff was very rude and not helpful at all. Especially the 2 girls. It is Wednesday at 1pm. They acted like it was Friday and they were about to close and I was a problem and annoying. The gentlemen was descent. I will NEVER go back there.

name: Christie Robbins
text: Everyone is always nice and strive to assure great customer service! I love this place!

name: Jeremy Ringler
text: Absolute best place to go for all your needs!

name: Capt. Dusty
text: Very good people a joy going into this shop

text: Very poor attitude toward me during a a firearms transfer. Rude for no reason

text: They would not offer a warranty even though I'm going to buy a $250 chainsaw not even a 10 or 15 day warranty better off going to retailer least you get a 30-day return

text: Great staff

text: Terrible and rude!

name: Nicole
text: Great pawn shop   awesome people

name: Trevor Brewton
text: Awful place awful people. Completely scammed me. They lie to get their money.

text: I've bought several things at this shop and been very happy with the experience. The cost of the things I bought compared to other shops is consistently less. I also needed to return something recently that didn't work out for what I needed it for within their one week policy, and they were very good about allowing the return. They also have lots of really unique items in their shop.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating.  We appreciate your business.

name: Sherri Tyus
text: they are just good folks!!

name: Thomas Carlisle
text: They always give great "out the door" deals on tools and guns!

name: Kim Payne
text: Everyone is very nice and welcoming. As soon as you walk in they welcome you and are very helpful with any questions you may have. I highly recommend this place for any of your pawn shop needs.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star rating.  Have a blessed day.

text: I have been several places trying to get a title loan. Everywhere I have been in the past it was such a hassle and too much paper work. I think his name was Corey. Corey had me in and out of there in no time. He was very professional and got me every dollar my car was worth. Unfortunately, when covid hit money got tight and I got behind on a payment or two. Instead of hounding me and threatening to take my car , Corey worked out a payment plan and we got it worked out! name: Jacob Anthony
text: I went to this pawnshop to pawn a MSI Gaming laptop ($1000 brand new) and an ESP EC-1000 electric guitar ($950 brand new), all still in mint condition. I arrived at the pawn shop at 5:30pm, and they close at 6pm. I sat in the parking lot for a minute to finish up the phone call that I was on, before I was rudely interrupted by the owner beating on my passenger said window. I rolled down the window, and he said “Whatever business you have to do here needs to be taken care of now because my wife has a hair appointment.” And I responded with “It’s 5:30. I thought you closed at 6”. And he responded with “You must not have heard me, but my wife has a hair appointment, and we have to go.” I almost left at that moment due to the absurdity and in professionalism in the conversation that I had just had with this man, but I wouldn’t make it to another pawn shop before closing. I bit my tongue and took my guitar and laptop inside. He immediately looked at the laptop and guitar and said “I have no interest in these.” I pointed to the wall of guitars that was behind him, and he finally said “fine. I’ll do $75 for both, but I can’t do more.” He literally had the audacity to offer me $75 for $1950 worth of product. His excuse was that guitars have terrible resale value, which is 100% false. I used to work at a pawnshop, and we ALWAYS took in guitars because the depreciation in price is very minimal. We even took in laptops at 60% of what used ones were selling for on eBay. But no, he offered me $75 for both, and then reminded me that his wife had a hair appointment, and that I had to make up my mind. There was no mind to be made up, because that was a completely ridiculous offer! He followed me to the front door upon my exit to lock it behind me...at 5:40pm. 20 minutes before they were due to close. Any grown adult should know not to make appointments that interfere with their work schedule, but his ignorance on products brought in further validates his ignorance in general. I went to A-Z Pawn the next day and received a loan of $450 for both items, because that’s all I needed. Do NOT go to this pawnshop. Not even as a last resort. They’re unprofessional, they’re rude, they offer TERRIBLE prices for EVERYTHING, and instead of looking up information about products brought in, he will either low-ball you because he doesn’t know their worth, or he just won’t accept it at all. Go elsewhere. This place is not worth your time.

name: Cajan Doll
text: Service was very rude both times I went first time to pawn my pistol second time to get it out I feel very discriminated against and will never shop there or do business there I've dealt with plenty pawn shops and this one is the worst they charge 300 percent interest which is ridiculous. The lady was being so racist told me you know you have to pay to get your gun out whole I'm standing there with my ticket and money in my hand my gun wasnt in there but five days because she said the FBI could take up to 20 days I could write more but you get the point

name: Jacob Anthony
text: This place is BY FAR the WORST pawn shop in all of Huntsville. I have visited this place a few times in the past, and every visit was a negative experience. For instance, I brought in a $350 Dewalt Drill set which he offered me $25 for. I immediately left and went to Redstone Pawn, who gave me $135. I tried to pawn a $3100 Paul Reed Smith electric guitar, and he said the most he could do was $150. I later pawned it at A-Z Pawn for $825. He knows very little about ANY products brought in, and begins to have an attitude if you tell him the prices that he offers are absolutely ridiculous. I recommend A-Z Pawn or Redstone Pawn for all of your pawning/selling needs. But to be honest, ANY Pawn Shop in Huntsville is better than this dump!

name: Sherri Anderson
text: Because I am new at DSLR photography, I wanted to see if I could find a used camera to start out with before I invested in something new. The gentleman waiting on me was very nice and answered questions as much as he could as he pulled the cameras out for me to see. Then his supervisor came over and made him put all the cameras back. She told him that I could not look at them. I told her that the one I was looking at in particular was available brand new with accessories for about $75 more than they were charging, with a bundle of accessories included , and I was not able to make a decent decision without seeing their selection. She came back and said the camera bundle was available at Walmart for $500 but I have been researching this for several months and I know it's available on Amazon for about 350. Then I asked her if I could look at the others and she told me that the gentleman behind the counter could get fired for it. I'm not about to drop two or three hundred dollars on a used camera without the ability to examine it. I understand that the business is located in a high crime area, but I am a short middle-aged woman with no pockets and no purse, and there was no chance that I was going to steal anything from them and make it to the door. I guess this place is okay if you need to sell something for quick cash, but if you want to buy something and expect good customer service, your best bet would be to try someplace in Homewood or Vestavia where the customer service is a little bit more accommodating.

The lady wouldn't give me my money or a reason, I asked both multiple questions and neither could answer anything I asked, one was the owner, wow how can u have a business and not know anything about it unless they are lieng and that's what they do. Well I get a call 5 days later saying I was denied my pistol and all the can do is give me what I pawned it for $150. They would not give me any documentation of my denied return nor would they do anything to make this situation right. As far as I know they feed me a good line of bull, I took the bait and lost my $700 pistol for $150 and I done everything I was supposed to. I am having my lawyer looking into this so people please watch yourself with them if you do business with them because they won't.  ATF should be stopping by them soon to check paperwork and how their pay then check method works. Thanks and have a good day.

resp.text: Completing ATF paper work is a FEDERAL LAW----to purchase a firearm or get it out of pawn. This is not just  a requirement of our business. And you are correct you do only get back the amount you pawned it for.

It's quite obvious how these guys stay open. One sale a day will pay their lease, employees pay and the internet bill.

name: Steve Tubbs
text: Been to the Goldmine Pawn many times over the years and always had a pleasant experience and bought a good bit of merchandise even tho many things could have been purchased cheaper elsewhere. I traded at Goldmine Pawn because Tom the owner and his employees have been friendly and knowledgeable. However today’s experience was far under par. I was attempting to transfer ownership of a gun my friend no longer wanted, during the process my friend tried to get clarification on a question being asked on the questionnaire from  an employee. Another employee mistakenly thought he was asking me and very rudely started a dissertation on how we couldn’t be discussing the forms. I explained we weren’t that he was only asking for clarification. Instead of stopping or apologizing she kept on becoming even more forceful. I asked her to please be more pleasant when she expressed herself. At this the young gentleman waiting on us went off and said they were married and tore up everything. To let a misunderstanding get that far out of hand was unfortunate and immature. The owners were obviously not present. So sorry to lose one of my favorite places!

resp.text:
Mr Tubbs,

If there were any way to publish security footage on here, we would. When the owner returned to the store, he was made aware of the situation and shredded the paper himself, I did not tear up anything. During the process of assisting you and your friend, we agreed to do extra paperwork just to give you the customer service you are accustomed to here, and during that process you were instructed numerous times to direct your questions to an employee, not your friend. When a young female employee became more insistent you and your friend following these federal guidelines, you began to berate that employee on her method of instruction. Had it been left at that, we would have continued to help you. However, you continued by throwing your pen on the counter only to continue your harassment of our employee moments later. At that point we politely refunded your money and repeatedly told you to have a good day. Considering you even offered to apologize to our employee, you obviously knew you were in the wrong in some way, shape, or form. We are not in the business of turning people away, and we do hate that we lost a customer. But, our employees deserve the same respect you do. Again, we hope you have a good day.

name: Big Buck
text: I have spend lots of money here but will never spend a dime there again. The women there are extremely rude and think they know far more than they do . I will be happy to pay the high prices of Bass Pro shop and be treated  better there. For Gods sake go somewhere else and be treated like a valuable customer.  These people have a God complex

resp.text: Our 39 year old business would not be around today if we treated our customers like you describe. We do not have a "god complex", however we do know what is right and what is wrong.  Without more context it would be hard to go deeper into what happened, but I can assure you we have more knowledge that most places around, especially the big box stores you mentioned. Have a great day!

text: Love coming here and seeing the wide selection of firearms. Being a glock blue label dealer is always a plus.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, we strive for excellence and variety of products.

name: Jeff Alfred
text: It took forever for my brother to leave with his firearm. In all I spent close to an hour as my brother tried to purchase his firearm. The young boy with black hair behind the counter did not seem to know what he was doing and had to keep getting assistance. Not to mention, he lacked basic firearm knowledge when I spoke with him. The man with reddish hair was perhaps the most helpful and I wish we got him when visiting. Also, I’ve never seen a place photograph a person buying a firearm. Seems like a subtle violation of the 2A if you ask me. I’ve done tons of firearm purchases and never have I spent this long in a store nor have I every been photographed. If things change with my future visits I will adjust my rating but if not I doubt I will purchase from here again.

resp.text:
Jeff,

We will address you review point by point:

We are sorry that your visit took longer than expected- you may not be aware of the increase in traffic since COVID 19 started. Gun stores have been very overwhelmed, as well as the NICS background check system. Even to this day when things have slowed down, checks are still taking up to 30 minutes in some cases. This leads us to our second point-to try and decrease these wait times, we have new employees, one of which was helping you. You cannot be upset with how long a transaction is taking (part of which is out of our control) while simultaneously complaining about our efforts to train new people. Lastly, are you aware that nearly all gun stores have security cameras? Is that still an infringement on your rights? We also have a copy of your ID when buying a gun. Taking a picture of our customers (not just gun customers) for our internal system has been our policy for years with no complaints. I would suggest buying from individuals from now on if you're truly that concerned with your face being seen while buying a gun. Have a great day! -the man with the reddish hair

name: Leeann hyer
text: At least one of the female employees needs to be trained to know the difference between fine and fake diamonds. I needed to borrow enough to pay a bill this past Monday and the lady that waited on me informed me that my 1.25 Carat miner's cut diamond ring wasn't real and suggested that maybe I should go sell it to the jeweler that told me that it was ha! I left there very annoyed and went to the competitor down the road and was offered $1000 by the owner as soon as I walked through the door if I was interested in selling it. He looked at it for about 10 seconds and knew the value. I was still not interested in selling but I did borrow exactly what I needed and thanked him for his knowledge and interest. I'm not one to complain but she really made me mad. I left there feeling insulted. No customer should ever leave a business feeling that way. How can I walk into one shop and they not even offer the value of the gold in a ring and the other shop offer me $1000 cash if I would sell? Crazy..

resp.text:
Leeann,

We are sorry for the experience you had while trying to make a pawn. There must have been some kind of misunderstanding, so we do hope you can give us another chance someday soon.

name: Bailey Hart
text: jennifer the manager here is very rude and not helpful kicked me out of the range for being “disrespectful” after she piped in on a personal conversation very inappropriate and unprofessional will never return

resp.text:
Sorry Bailey.  You weren’t even with the two men that came in. You are the girlfriend of Mathew Crider.  We don’t allow cursing and disrespectful behavior in our range, and they never even made it down to the range. This was our response to your boyfriend.

“ The first question on our entry form for our GUN range is “Are you under any emotional distress?”. By the cursing at your family member in the store, we made the decision that you obviously WERE under some kind of emotional distress, and we did not want to see a repeat of that on the range with a deadly weapon. Jena made the correct move by not allowing you on our range, as a hothead with a gun is never a good idea. Not only are we concerned with YOUR safety, but for the safety of our other customers as well, including the family member you were with. We take safety very seriously here and we are not sorry that you were offended by that. Maybe next time you go to a gun range, curse out your family member BEFORE you show up, as to not make your anger issues so obvious. Have a great day! ”

name: Nick Bounds
text:
Poorly trained employees. The girl who assessed my AR didn't even know what an upper and lower receiver was. If you're going to buy and sell guns at least take the time to educate your employees.

Edit as per response from owner: Nobody is talking about how you don't buy built rifles, I sure am tickled that you remember me but I'm simply stating your employee didn't know basic gun terminology. But you should know, you were "standing there". Great response though, looks really good and professional that you accuse patrons of lying. Just accept that you're outclassed by other pawn shops in the area in both customer service and employee training.

resp.text: Anyone who has visited our store, knows that statement is incorrect. We SELL them daily. I was standing there. She was merely trying to confirm it was a “built” AR, and even went to the owner to double check on her correct assessment, as she’s only worked here a couple of months. I’m sorry our insurance company won’t allow us to take mismatched Frankenstein firearms, but don’t take it out on us, by leaving a poor, untrue review.  5 stars on our Facebook page.  Please read reviews there.

text: I'm not one to frequent pawn shops for fear I'll see something I cannot live without and then justify purchasing it based on a lack of factual knowledge of what it might actually cost elsewhere. Its nice to know these two people exist actually.  They were very personable never ignoring customers questions while being very attentive to who they were helping at that moment as well.  I'd definitely say they actually liked their jobs.  And for that alone I think I will go back.  Just so you know, Friday afternoons are when this place gets really busy.  And that doesn't mean more merchandise on the floor.  After all it is a PAWN shop. My suggestion is try Saturday afternoon sometime after noon.  That's when I was there and it was great.

When knocking on door I was told by the staff that they close at 12:00 on Saturday.  It was 12:02.  To come back when they are open. Apparently they are only open 10:30 to 12:00 on Saturdays. Google says open Saturday’s till 5, you would assume they would be open. But apparently they will lock the door in your face. Not the kind of place I want to spend my money at.

name: Rebecca Spivey
text: I wanted to rent a truck or trailer from a different U-Haul location on Saturday, but that place was closed, so U-Haul called to tell me to go Depot Pawn. I said I didn't want to rent from them and canceled the order, but time was running out to get anything from another place, so I ended up going there anyway, despite my better judgment telling me to delay until another day. Andy was nice when I picked up the trailer, and I told the woman there – his wife, I think – that I didn't want the insurance because American Express would cover it. They charged me for insurance anyway. I had to keep the trailer two extra days because I had trouble with my truck, and when I called to tell Andy I was bringing it back, he gave me the total. I said it was wrong, but they wouldn't fix it. I called U-Haul and was told they would call Depot to straighten it out, but he still overcharged me and was rude about it. I told him I'd told the woman I didn't want the insurance, but he refused to take it off and said it was between me and U-Haul, after the U-Haul rep already confirmed to me that I was being overcharged. Then he acted like he was doing me a favor by taking one day's rental off because I was a little late bringing it back today. I said that was because I was on the phone with U-Haul disputing the charge, but he still acted like he was being nice. Not nice at all. I don't appreciate being conned and then treated rudely. This is why I didn't want to go to Depot in the first place. I don't like dealing with pawn shops and don't want to give them my money. I'll never rent anything at Depot Gun & Pawn again, and I sure won't ever go there to buy anything.

name: Robert Jackson

Definitely recommend for strings and amps, whether buying or trading.  Rare to see someone in that line of work make fair offers... most pawn(like) shops lowball the crap out of you.  Andy (on the pawn side) is a good guy too but don't expect to get paid what you ask for, though of course that's his job.  Good selection of everything too, from tools to electronics to guns to jewelry, and not ridiculously marked up.  Just negotiate!

text: I love this place, great guys no pressure and real straight shooters when you are trying to pawn as well. I greatly prefer being told " we just aren't selling a lot of these " to having an insult price thrown at me like other places will do. The do free FFL transfers for Vets and owner is a Vet as well so he makes extra sure to take good care of military.  Selection is the job highlight. Lots of variety from vintage and unique to the newest MSR equipment. They have a good sense of what to keep around as well which let's them make the most out of a smaller shop. Generators, TV's, a few Instruments and Amps, Tools etc., Jewelry/ watch cabinet, and an expertly stocked gun rack.

name: Robin Boydstun
text:
Today 7/16/2021 we went into money miser pawn to buy an air conditioner and they had 2. We purchased the more expensive of the 2 got it home 15 minutes later to find out that it didn't blow cold or have the remote control that goes to it so we called and ask if they had the remote that we couldn't change the temp and that it blows hot. The employee after putting us on hold for awhiles aid they don't refund for merchandise but they would give us $10 to go buy a remote for it. We paid $138 to them for an air conditioner that doesn't work. I must say I am very sad that I got ripped off.
I don't recommend them at all

resp.text: Hello My name is Ken Barnes, I am the General Manager here at Money Mizer. When you called  you spoke to one of my employees that works here and asked if we had the remote. We did not have the remote. You stated that you needed the remote to change some settings on it and that you could not get it cold enough without the remote. My employee made me aware of what went on and that you were asking for a remote control that we did not have, we did place you on a brief hold so we could find the remote locally for you and offered to refund the cost of the remote as you stated you just needed the remote to change the settings. We tracked one down here locally we told you exactly where it was and the price for it and offered to refund that part of the sale to cover the cost of the remote. I am sorry if you feel like this is bad customer service if you would like to come in and see me I would be happy to speak with you about this situation.

text: So as many of you know service had to be extremely good or extremely bad for me to leave a survey. In this case service was extremely good. This was the first time I went to this pawn shop after calling around Thomas was the only one that was polite on the phone and welcomed me and my husband when we went there. OMG, Fran was the best its nice to see a woman knowledgeable in ammunition. This is truly a team of experts Thomas was really amazing when to came to discussing products and services and extremely patient when I was changing my mind back and forth on my firearm. I could continue to write but its best you get the experience yourself. I live in Georgia by the way was passing through; however, I will be going back!!!!! Keep up the good work. Oh yea and I saw ALOT of regulars... So what that tell you??

name: setha2z
text: Don't buy from this business.  I ordered three NOS (New Old Stock) clips for my Detonics .45 ACP.  They arrived quickly and visually resembled the item being sold, but were knock-offs.  One jammed immediately, and would not unjam.  I promptly emailed a detailed description of the problem, requesting replacements.  No response was received as of 3 months later.  I tossed them out.  Cost = $88 clips + $6 ship + $20 gunsmith = $114 wasted.

text: Worst establishment in Marshall County. If you have anything of value, don't pawn it here because it's very likely to be damaged when you get it back. text: Never take anything to joe,s even if u r dieing .find another pawn shop  ,like pawn max, I was low on cash and needed about 40.00 to tide me over.I took a tackle box with about 375.00 in tackle, plus a my best bass rod,and real ,they gave me 20.00 for all,,,over 450.00 dollars worth of stuff! It's a damn shame ,,they take advantage of ppl they know really need the money,after I get paid ,I'll get my stuff out,and never use them again!

name: Tom Courtright
text: This guy plays games with prices and is very dishonest. He posted an item to eBay and I had the winning bid and it was a very good price. It was a gun barrel and I paid for it, and was supposed to receive it on November 5th. When it didn't come, I emailed him to find out what was going on. He stated that he will track it through the USPS. He then emailed back and stated that they lost it. I did some searching myself with the tracking number, and the USPS website claims that the barrel never got to their location to ship. I emailed again and he said that the USPS told him it could take up to 30 days to track. BS. Without me asking for a refund, he refunded my money (so that I couldn't get eBay involved) even when I was still ok with waiting the "30 days". I feel that he printed a label to ship and then decided to pull the "I can get a better price if I relist this" routine and guess what I found when I searched his items on eBay... the same exact barrel that I won the bid for and it was re-posted under a different item number on eBay. Dishonest and fraudulent.

name: Ike Young
text: Sent me the wrong drum for my 450 bushmaster,  instead of a 30 rd 450 drumI got a 90 rd 223 drum . Fyi, when I would put over 1 rd in the drum they would simply fly out & when I called I simply got a some one will call u bacc not a let's fix this 130 dollar mistake right now.

name: LiveLaugh MakeLove
text: Pawned an expensive Diamond ring to pay my light bill. All i needed was 75.00 and the ring appraised for 1,100.00. Went to get it out and these crooks brought me a different ring. Same band, different diamond. When i told them it wasnt the same ring, they said the number was the same. The diamond was alot smaller with cracks all through it. The guy just got the ring back and walked off. I then got to looking at the other rings and asked one of the other workers to see one of them. Low and behold there was my diamond placed in a new band with a 650.00 price tag. I lost my ring because these crooks stole what was mine. Plss dont take any of your valuables to this pawn shop! I hear hes in a law suit right now because its somthing he does. Why is this place still in business as this happened to me many yrs ago? Scam artist!!

text:
Rip off!!!! Was charged $120 for a USED tool bag and 5 USED hand tools. $60 for a used tool bag I later found out I could have got brand new from Home Depot for $59. Was charged and additional $60 for 5 USED NON-NAME Brand hand pliers for a total of $120.
This place is a joke a scam and a rip off, save your money go else where not only will you get better service you will get better quality and fair pricing.

resp.text: I am sorry you feel you were not treated fairly, but if you were unhappy with the price of the items that you knew were used you could have placed the items back on the shelf an not purchased them. This is a pawn shop so it should not be a surprise that most all the items for sale are used items. We check prices daily to make sure we are 30 to 50% below fair market value. Name brand items are priced accordingly.

name: Tammy Balentine
text: Absolutely the rudest pawn shop I've ever felt with! Private messages me when I gave them a Facebook review not about product but only to be rude and complain about their review! I messaged their business around 10am on sat they didn't respond till the next day being terrible towards me and my opinions,  the other businesses I messaged about my husband's new gun responded right away or at least by the end of the day.

resp.text: Rude customer, she did not appreciate us trying to honestly work through the situation of her review.  She left a review upon false information, there were never any questions that could have been answered about the "product" in the time frame she "offered."  The sad part is she could have made a short, simple phone call to avoid her situation.  Rash and ill tempered she would only see it her way. Short sidedness, a lack of understanding, and poor communication on her part lead to this review.  Her opinion is the only one that matters to her, and we cannot please someone out looking for problems.   We fulfilled our end of what we advertised.  We are thankful for our customers, their respect of our business practices, and common sense!

name: Cedric Banks
text:
Wanted to spend good money but no was interested in helping me, visited 3 times to give them a chance not to leave me with a bad impression but it was painfully clear I was not welcome, not trying to play the race card but I did not feel welcome and there was no indication of concern to help me.
Thanks for giving me the opportunity to shop else where.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel this way Mr. Banks.  Did you ask for help?  I would like to address the situation with any employee that would refuse to help an interested customer, buying or not.  We pride ourselves in giving the best customer service we can.  If you'd like to come back in and ask for Grant, I will personally help you myself.  There are no race cards to be played up here as well Mr. Banks.  We do not interpret race that way.  Everyone is a customer, no matter the race, no matter the clothes, everyone matters.  We've been here over 25 years for a reason.

name: Bob Gohn
text: Fantastic place! You never know what you might find at Bama Pawn. The folks there are very friendly and helpful with all of your needs

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback!  We do our best!  Come back and see us!

name: Trevor Bright
text: I have been in the store multiple times and on every occasion I haven't had one employee greet me or ask of I needed help. I had great intentions of buying something but it seemed that they figured since I'm a young I'm not going to spend alot of money so there is no point in helping him...

resp.text: We're sorry for any experiences you've had where you were not greeted or helped in our store. We actually pride ourselves on our customer service and tell all of our employees to greet customers when they come and go. I'm not making an excuse but at times we do get busy either helping other customers or keeping up with all the paperwork that comes through the store so we may miss a customer here and there. But if you've been in multiple times we should have helped you. As far as judging you by your age or if you're going to spend a lot of money... we have a huge range of prices on tools, guns, and accessories. So whether you're going to spend money or not we aren't going to discriminate against you based off your age, race, gender, or even the size of your wallet. Again, we apologize that you had such bad experiences in our store but we appreciate you bringing it to our attention. Hopefully you'll come back and give us the chance to treat you differently.

name: Randy Tucker
text: They try to get rich off every sale. No customer service. Rude. Goto Tucker Pawn priceville for a great deal. I saved 119.00 on one purchase and Tuckers are great people. No relation to me but great people.

resp.text:
If this customer has been in our store, he or she has never addressed any issues with us or asked us to price match, I've never had any issues price matching Tuckers pricing, ever.  We typically compete with other stores in our radius just fine.  Academy Sport is right down the road as well.  We often get phone calls of them having to price match us.  Also, I find it odd the customer has the same last name whether they "claim" no relation or not and praise tuckers all in the same review.  Never the less, all of our other reviews speak for themselves.  It's a shame someone sink this low to jeopardize our ratings.  I hope this review speaks multitudes for the type of person this is.

Just a comparison for all you googler's out there, check out our pricing vs their pricing on Davidson's Gallery of Guns, it just proves this was a low blow and we are cheaper.

resp.text: We are a mom and pop store, family emergency's can't be helped.  Nor were you in the parking lot at 8:40 AM when I arrived.  We went above and beyond to remedy your situation and we cannot help your attempt to pickup your merchandise at the last minute and late might I add. We did not have to do what we did.  Nor any of the help we've ever given to you and your family.  I do apologize for running late.  We do however appreciate the review and know where we stand after years of business based on one instance, and not all the other smooth transactions we have shared together.  I do not understand the rash decision to sacrifice a relationship over a temper tantrum, a personal mistake, and 10 minutes. - Grant C, Management

name: Bob Wilkens
text:
I would give zero stars if possible. They notify the FBI of a firearm purchase, whether exempt due to Alabama Concealed Pistol Permit, or not. You buy, they call the FBI. No friend of privacy, and all it would take would be a call to the sheriff office to confirm Permit not revoked for some crime.

I bought two firearms prior to getting permit, took week long delays, commented non-stop how i needed to get a permit to stop the delays and invasion of privacy over a simple purchase and they never said a thing.

Got the permit, had an ordered pistol sent to them, and when i drove to town to pick up the gun, they told me they were running the check anyhow, and always did. This is not posted anywhere in store as i write this. They did this KNOWING i would take a delay and another 1.5hr round trip that meant nothing to them, and never said a word before as for, "yer permit's no good, here, pal."

And really folk, are you going to trust ANYone who voluntarily reports you to the FBI regarding a purchase, when not forced to by law, but on their own, when they know you have the check already done for the permit, and do not care if it means you might have to come back up to a week later from however how far? Is this our brave new world? It reminds me more of neighborhood informants in Russia in 1950.....some progress....and we are all so much safer now, right?

Yes, they are allowed to do this. Technically, anyone can. But is someone who rats you out to the FBI, just to do it, your kind of dealer? Unbelievably, many indictrinated people would agree with them. They also would have made fine Occupied Territory informants.

resp.text: The FTA requires a mandatory background check on all gun purchases .  Any pawn shop could lose their license for noncompliance IT IS CALLED THE BRADY LAW!!  Even Law Enforcement officers undergo the same background check.  AGAIN IT IS THE LAW!

text: Real nice guy I did business with! He was the last pawn shop open as far as I could find within a reasonable driving distance and about to close at 5:30. Money is short right now with covid going around and mom and I desperately needed some cash for food and moms prescriptions.  Just that little gesture of kindness helped us out so much, I wish there were more people like him around! I totally recommend Quintard Jewelry & Pawn!!!

name: Zach Cook
text: Pocket Pawn is the single greatest thing to ever happen to Alabama, maybe even the whole country. As I entered one afternoon, a gentleman named Sam approached me and asked if there was anything he could assist me with. It was at this point that I realized Sam had an incredible glow surrounding him, and he was also wearing a halo and sporting feathery wings. With tears in my eyes, I spoke: "Well, to be honest, I was just looking for a few PS4 games." He responded, "Come with me, my child." I grabbed his hand and he lifted me towards Heaven. I stood before a vast sea of clouds and warm sunlight as I saw all my friends and family who had passed on. "How do I achieve this level of holiness?" I asked. "Well" he spoke, "the first thing you need to do is let me sell you this gun." And the gun was a reasonable price. Blessed be Sam. Blessed be Pocket Pawn.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 stars, Zach!

name: Red
text: I called Pocket Pawn last week and told Jacob, "My wife just went into labor and I dont have money to get her to the hospital. What can I pawn for gas money?" Jacob just said "Hang on" and hung up the phone. Twenty minutes later, I heard a knock on the door, and it was Jacob! He had a taxi drive him to our house while he watched baby delivery YouTube videos. As soon as I opened the door, he ran into the house and immediately started helping my wife deliver our baby. Within 3 hours of our baby being born, Jacob had already taught her to speak, read, and walk. Once everything was said and done, I shook Jacob's hand and asked "How can I ever repay you?" He said "Your thanks is payment enough", and then he went and started our baby a college savings fund and deposited $6,000 into it." We never actually pawned anything with him, but he will forever be our favorite Pawnbroker up at Pocket Pawn. We actually ended up naming our daughter 'Jacobina Allen Sweeny' in honor of our favorite Pawnbroker!!! 5Stars! Would Pawn Again!

name: Marlana Robles
text:
Amazing. Five stars are not enough. Here are some noteworthy things about these guys--in no particular order.
Kind. I first noticed this when I left their store right at closing time. They had locked the doors behind me, but when an elderly gentleman desperately tried the door, they kindly let him in and helped him.
Honest. I visited this store in search of an item that someone had 'borrowed' and then pawned. They worked to make things right because they have no desire to have stolen goods in their store.
Funny. Have you read their signs? "Too hot to keep changing this sign. Come inside for good deals!" "We buy used DVDs. Except for Batman III. It was awful." "How bow dah?" "For the last time--NO. You cannot pawn your kids!"
Respectful. They have a beautiful parking spot designated for combat-injured veterans. Gulp. Many folks SAY they support veterans. This certainly shows that.
Friendly. Every single person in there has made me, and everyone else coming in , feel like we were each the most important person to walk through the door that day.

Thanks so much for being so great Pocket Pawn!!!!

MKR
MSgt USMC
Retired

resp.text:
Marlana,

Thank you so much for the amazing review! This is probably the best review we've ever gotten! We really appreciate the kind words!

name: Shane Akers
text: This is one of, if not the best place I've ever had the pleasure of doing business with when it comes to transferring or purchasing a firearm. Mr. Jeff Smith as always been extremely helpful and friendly with every transaction I've ever been a part of there. Not only do they sell and transfer firearms, they also have a pawn business. I've never used that aspect of their business, but going over some of the negative reviews that are posted on here, it makes you wonder if people don't understand the concept behind a pawn shop. It's like they expect to go in there to pawn something and get what they paid for it or either what they think it's worth. Then, if they happen to not come back and pick it up, and happen to see it for sale in the store they're upset because of the sale price that's put on it. The pawn shop is in the business of making money. And I've always thought that that's how you make money is to buy low and sell higher. But hey, what do I know? But I do know that it's a pleasure doing business with Jeff Smith  at Alabama Gun and pawn and Russellville Alabama.

its how sales work   you put a little money into the product and turn it for a high profit
if you don't like it then open your own pawn shop and buy peoples stuff for what they think you should and try to sell it to the next guy that's expecting a great deal    you want be in business long because you want be able to pay the bills      get your head out of the sand you sissified liberal

text: This place is professional and organized, the staff is nice and have a large amount of team members to handle a full house. This is where my business will belong. name: Pew Pew Review
text: Justin, Tara, and whole crew were completely awesome!  I showed up a few minutes before closing time to purchase a pistol and they stayed late waiting on the background check to clear.  In the meantime, they put up with my constant bartering and badgering, lol.  They were very easy to work with and have one of the best selections of firearms in stock during a time when most shops have very slim pickings. Thanks for the SIG mat Justin!!!!

name: Sam Busbin
text: Redstone pawn has an all around amazing staff and they are genuinely a pleasure to deal with, like any pawn shop you may be low balled at times, but at least these guys are polite and respectful about it, and are usually receptive to negotiations unlike every other pawn shop in the Huntsville area, where it's a take it or leave it attitude. They also have an exceptional selection of brand new handguns and some selection of long guns and also a good selection of used firearms with usually very reasonable prices outside of a pandemic economic environment for firearms. All around my favorite pawn shop, I don't go anywhere else anymore. They even send you text reminders on your phone when your loans come up for renewal about 3-5 days ahead of time. All in all, I've had numerous great experiences here, and I constantly recommend them to everyone who asks.

text: Great store with lots of high quality items. I’ve been in a few times and I will tell you that you’re not going to find any Harbor Freight junk in here. I have an iPad mini 2 that isn’t in great condition, has a cracked screen, and they have pawned it for me twice for 40$.

name: Misti Daniel
text: If I could leave no stars I would, I used to think redstone pawn was a fair and just business. In the past I've been helped alot by wes and others who work there,  but the way I was treated last month was unfair, shady and down right wrong. A couple of months back I bought a 9mm Taurus hand pistol we did all the proper paperwork and I was approved. In may I got in a bind and went to redstone pawn as I have in the past and got a loan on my gun. When I came back to pick it up  wes made me take another background check and said that I was delayed and to come back in a cpl of days. First off I should have not had to go threw that process again the gun was already mine and I have a receipt of proof of ownership, I was just paying back my loan and picking up my property. When he contacted me back a couple of days later he didn't call he texted me and said i was denied and kept my gun that I have receipt of ownership for nor did he give the full value of the gun he gave me the loan money back mind you I have an expired gun permit. This was a scam to cheat a customer out of money and his property and i want stand for it, I'll be taken more legal action against this business and show them that you can't treat people like this. I was a good customer to them and they handled me very rough and not fair at all, businesses like this get over because as consumers we dont know the law in Alabama you only have to a permit to carry a firearm not to own one. They violated my second amendment right also no way I failed a background check I work for DHR and I passed the first one I took for the gun nothing has changed so why did I fail this time. Because I didn't fail and I've bought guns from Larry's pistol and pawn which is were  I should have stayed I would advise all consumers not to deal with these crooks, know the power of your dollar and

resp.text: Mr. Daniel this review is completely unwarranted.  We are a Federal Firearms Licensed Dealer.  We are regulated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms(ATF) and comply with all federal and state laws.  All individuals who are purchasing or redeeming a firearm have to pass a federal background check.  We run all federal background checks through the FBI NICS(National Instant Criminal Background Check System).  If an individual is denied through the government background check we can not release a firearm to them.  We tried to explain the situation to you in the store and give you the proper information to appeal the decision of the federal background check but you were too frustrated for us to help you through that process.  This is a situation out of our control.  We are more than happy to assist with your appeal.  If you are able to rectify the situation with the FBI/ATF we would work with you to get you back the firearm for the price to redeem the original loan amount.  If you are unable to appeal the background check we would be happy to pay you the difference in the value of the gun minus what was owed to payoff the original loan.  We appreciate each customer and their business, we are not interested in taking advantage of anyone.

text: The owner's are friendly and they are helpful. The prices are pretty good I got a new .380 for under $300. It's made in Las Vegas and comes with a lifetime warranty. name: John Bobbitt
text:
I'm your local google guide...and earned my title and stripes writing reviews of just about every business I've been to since I moved here, a year and a half ago. In-depth reviews and recommendations that I hope cut through the BS and give you some real insight. Some were good. Some were bad. But they were all as open and honest as I could make em, and with an understanding that sometimes you catch em on a bad day. And a bad review doesnt mean you can't get a second shot to improve it....

That said, I've bought more tools and electronics from this place than anywhere else including Lowe's, Home Depot, and Grainger, and Best Buy combined. I buy em here because the price is right, because the guys have gotten to know me and will cut a deal on your word if they've seen it's good, they've honored the return policy the two times I had to use it, and they probably do more favors for people than anyone else around there.... pawn shops aside. It's amazing they make any money. They even took my number down once, and every time an 18v lithium Skill powertool came in, I got a call. In 4 months I had THE ENTIRE COLLECTION MADE BY Skill for 18v,  with 4 extra batteries, 3 chargers, brand carry bags, and a spare drill collet.

So they get the third of my 5 stars. If you need a pawn broker in the area, these are your guys.

resp.text:
John,
We appreciate your business very much! Thank you for the considerate and thoughtful review. You are more than welcome anytime here, we thank you tremendously for your patronage.
-M&M Family

text: Today I stopped by this pawn shop with the intention of just getting a smartwatch. I walked out of there with not only a smart watch but an electric guitar and a clarinet. I will absolutely stop by there again to give them my business because they took care of me when I was patient and waiting with them. They have my business always. I cannot highly recommend them enough. 10 out of 10 experience.

text:
About a month ago was my first time visiting the store. Upon walking in– it's new, spotless-clean and less "like" a traditional pawn shop and more a gun store. The customer service was top-notch and absolutely the best selection of new firearms in Baldwin County.

I suggest you talk with Daniel, he was super helpful throughout the entire process, knowledgeable about the firearms and products at the counter. I purchased a new firearm, ammunition and more.

So if you are looking for a pawnshop in Baldwin County (or gun store) you found it.
Daniel, Tyler & his wife along with the entire team at Anchor Pawn truly do offer the best in town. I'll definitely be back on the regular and recommend this place to everyone.

name: Steven Roggensack
text: After placing trust in the owners of this establishment, I soon realized I was mistaken upon attempting to procure my loaned handgun. The employee overseeing my loan let me pawn the firearm for a profit for the shop, fully aware I would require an in state liscense to get it back did not inform me, only for me to discover this upon paying in full to do so. Now I either have to have my license changed states, or hopefully find a shop they can send it to. I only have two stars because one star is clearly someone with personal vendetta. I don't have extensive experience with them, but this one interaction has provided enough reason for me to never do business with them again.

name: Faith Ellen
text: HUGE SCAM!!! If I could give zero stars, I would. As other reviews stated, they try to claim that your REAL GOLD jewelry is plated when in fact it is real. I came in with receipts confirming that my gold was real and they still tried to tell me it was fake. I went to Simon's Jewelers the SAME day and got 200$+ on my apparent "fake gold" when I was offered less than 10-15$ at this place. The workers pupils were huge... definitely some type of substance abuse going on there. IF YOU WANT TO BE SCAMMED OUT OF MONEY, THIS IS DEFINITELY THE PLACE TO GO!

text: I buy all of my firearms from chris and his staff theyre super knowledgeable and helpful and will go out of their way to find me something they dont have 5 stars for service and exceptional people

name: Mark Toland
text: Go there periodically. Chris is very nice and really helpful. People need to realize that it's a pawn shop not a charity. They have to make money on the stuff they buy. If you want top dollar, pay for an advertisement and deal with people and see what it's like.  Also saw one review from someone who bought something that had a problem and never even made an attempt to see if they would do anything just posted a bad review because the receipt said As Is. Maybe a call to ask before you thrash someone. Maybe it's their own fault because they didn't try it or check it out before paying and walking out and writing a bad review.  Really sad part is Chris the manager is not that type of person and I would bet if they had the decency to call or stop by he would have done right by them. It's a sad state when people just say bad things and didn't even bother to try. Maybe the problem is the too lazy to try reviewer and not the store or the employees. Always amazed by people who use the internet to bully and be mean and do stuff like that. I put my real name on all my reviews which have thousands of views and I always give the places a chance to address any issues I've ever had. If they do right by me no harm no foul, if not then  I choose.  This online  bullying is hurting all of us. Treat others the way you want to be treated. Maybe the world would be a better place for all of us. Remember you get more with honey than vinegar.

I had a Xbox One & he said they’re about 15 yrs old so tell me why they were selling them for nearly $200 but he can’t even give me $100 to sale it back.

name: Rashawn Little
text:
"I drove to Montgomery and got 350 for a saxophone that Pawn Express Of Troy refused to buy

purchased  an abandoned  storage  unit at an auction in Jacksonville fl and stumbled  upon a used saxophone  i reached out to pawn express troy and one of the associates told me one the phone to bring it in and they'll  take a look I drove from Brantley al to troy al and one the male associates offered  80 dollars for it but couldn't  pawn because I grabbed  my expired  ID by mistake so about 2 weeks later I drove back and and talked with now a female  associates who I told I was offered  80 dollars  for the saxophone  and she also offered  80 dollars as well but after looking the saxophone brand up online USED OR NOT its worth a little over 500 dollars... me having no intrest for it, all I ask was "can we do 100" because its not In the best condition missed a few tiles that sit on the key pads and minor gold fading as all used instruments do "especially woodwind instruments" she called a lady (brandi) over for a second opinion  and the lady very nasty told me "we not interested in buying because it would be hard for us to sale". My problem is 2 associates gave me an offer for 80 and just because  I ask for 20 more dollars on a sax worth 500, now all of a sudden  "were not interested in buying" very rude and very unprofessional. You definitely  cant try to low blow everyone i guess the fact that im a young "BLACK "man she figured i just wanted fast cash NOT AT ALL. if I would have sold  the sax for 80 like I originally  intended  on doing they would have restored  it for lil to nothing  and had it out on the show room floor for 500 dollars bottom line they they'll offer Jesus a dollars  for each nail just to sale it to the railroad track for 100 dollars each .

resp.text: Sorry you had a bad experience but I’m glad you finally got what you were looking for. Hope you have a Happy New Year.

name: Matthew dickey
text: I came to peewees In need of some cash. I dealt with Alfred Streeter. He’s very honest and straightforward and it’s a no haggle kind of deal. You are in and out. Each time I have dealt with him he has given me a fair price for what I have pawned or sold. We’re talking about a pawnshop here so you’re not going to get what your item is worth. They are in the business of making money so if you expect that you need to sell your stuff on let go or something to someone who is willing to pay the price. But if you are in need of some quick cash and a fair price I would highly recommend peewees time on Charlotte Road. The whole staff is very nice but Mr. Streeter has always been a straight shooter.

name: TONY REEVES
text: Great service and very kind and understanding

name: Jennifer Osman
text: I went in Pee Wee pawn shop today and my experience was not a good one. I have never in my life had someone treat me the way this employee did. If I knew her name I would absolutely call her out. This was at the Trussville location and there were only two employees that I saw. But it was the woman that happen to be available when I came into the store. She was a straight up ass hole. Rolling her eyes when I asked a question as if it was the dumbest thing she had ever heard.  Or as if I was waisting her time. As I told her what I needed to pawn her attitude towards me was hateful from the start the least she could do is be polite and say that they were not interested in what I was trying to pawn at the time. Instead she said she would maybe give me a dollar for it. As she laughed under her breath. That behavior was so uncalled for. And then when I pointed out something on the clearance table that was still marked 60 dollars she stomped her foot and in a aggrevated tone said ok fine let me see it. Now I understand what she was telling me. And I understand why that product that was similar to mine was on the clearance table because it wasn't  selling well. But none the less it was still worth more than a dollar. But she apparently thought I could not comprehend that because of  her childish body gesture's. What she would not take the time to hear was that I had no intention of letting my item be sold in the store. I just needed to pawn it for a little while because life is not easy sometimes but thanks for making my day a little brighter. I wasn't looking for sympathy when I went in, but is it to much to ask for you to just be polite to someone you don't know.   Finally I said to the woman, " you know what, I haven't done anything to you to deserve such a attitude. I will never be back to this store again." And then she had the audacity to reply with, " good deal you have a great day!" GOOD DEAL!!!! Are you kidding me. If you hate your job that much then go do something else instead of being a jerk to your customers I really don't think the owner would appreciate that at all. I know if I had worked hard enough to open three different location and had all that going the last thing I would want is people walking through my doors to be treated that way. resp.text: Mr Weaver --- We are so sorry you were not happy with the result of your defaulted layaway. You had placed an item on our 90 day layaway program in Oct 2017 . We tried to contact you on several occasions after not hearing from you again since your $20 pmt in June 2018. We held that item another 3 months after that last pmt before defaulting. We do work with our customers on our layaway and pawn payments     ( we held your 90 day layaway for 11 months ). As you well know we have been in business over 25 years and although we try to make everyone happy that is not always the case. We do hope to do business with you and your family again in the future. Thanks Tom

I've always loved shopping at Bradfords. They also have a lot of great things to buy from electronic to jewelry they have a great selection of jewelry too. Also I'm not sure if they still do a lot of pawning or buying jewelry and guns but used to be if u need a little extra money for the month you could pawn your items and get them back for low cost. Just ask they are very friendly to everyone so be sure and check em out if you are near it I'm pretty sure you'll find something to buy or something you like 👍  GREAT PRICES!!!! name: Jacob Lee
text: By far the best Pawn Shop in the area! Competent and very friendly staff and a very nice and clean place. The staff were knowledgeable and made appropriate and competitive offers for the items I wanted to pawn or sell. It was refreshing to walk into a pawn shop that felt like an actual store, compared to most Pawn Shops that have product in disarray on the shelves and you feel dirty when you leave. Keep up the good work guys!

resp.text: We appreciate your business!

name: Brittney Kirkland
text: I got my wedding ring sized through them within the last 2 weeks. When I got to the car my husband realized that the piece that connected the 2 rings together was broken off. Took it immediately back into the shop and the older woman working there told him that it was “probably removed for sizing”. Spoke with 2 jewelers from 2 other business to verify that it should have been removed and both of them said that there would have been absolutely no need in removing that part and that it was probably done accidentally and they are just saying that it “had to be removed” to cover themselves and not take ownership.  I absolutely will not go to money mizer again. And to think that my husband was about to purchase 2 guns from this location this month. We will definitely be taking our business elsewhere from now on, as will my entire family.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Management has just became aware of this incident. Please reach out to our store manager, Ashley, regarding this and we will be more than happy to assist you and rectify the troubles you have had regarding the resizing of the wedding set.

name: MIsael Arenas
text:
Went in to inquire about some handguns, one man was behind the counter on the phone and did not acknowledge us there. Another couple male and female was behind main counter, no greeting nor asked if we needed help today? Ever other shop I been to knows how to greet you.
From the looks of the shop it did not have many items to bargain for. Guns where over priced by hundreds even shotgun over priced. Not many electronic.

resp.text: We apologize for your unsatisfactory customer service. We do pride ourselves on our customer service and are sincerely sorry if you were not helped or felt ignored. It was not our intention to upset you and would be more than happy to try to make things right. We are willing to price match any item we can as well as are willing to work with any price on used items. We are low on electronics becasue of the holiday sales we have been having and have sold out of most, however, we do have new items that come out every day. Please come down and let us make things right. Thank you for shopping with us in the first place and we do hope to see you again soon.

resp.text: We are glad you enjoyed your experience with Money Mizer!

Charlotte knows us by name and she’s knows what we like to buy. She’s always ready to tell us what she has waiting when we walk in the door. I would recommend this store if you like pawn shopping.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We do apologize for any troubles you encountered with us. It is never our intention to make customers feel like we are ignoring them and if you come back down, we would be more than glad to help you with anything you need. We pride ourselves in customer service and will do whatever it takes to make sure our customers are happy.

text: I have Purchased numerous Items from this location with no issues and great prices.  I went in to sell them an item and they insulted me with the offer. I was told it was because they could not find anything like it on the “auction” web site they use. Disappointing visit.  Will never return.

Hello Richard,

We apologize for your recent experience in our store and will address our staff accordingly. We do try our best to present fair offers to our customers regarding their belongings. Your items no matter how new you say it is, they are second hand therefore we can't pay you what you paid the store to get it.

name: tonya
text: This Used to be one of the best pawn shops around. Since they have changed locations though, they have become rather difficult. The staff is rude and unwelcoming, and their selection of merchandise has become stale and bland. It definitely does not help that the prices are also outrageous. There are much better pawn shops than this one.

resp.text: Hello Tonya, I am very sorry to hear about your experience at our store.  We pride ourselves on customer service, We have always greeted everyone that comes in with courtesy and respect.  That has not changed since we have moved.  All our price are negotiable and we rotate our inventory daily.   We strive hard to make everyone happy but realize this is impossible.  We encourage you to stop back in and give us another try.

name: Wargasm644
text: Went in to look for a guitar. Found a really nice one hanging on the wall. I know what they sell for at music stores and eBay. An employee named Alex asked me if I’d like to plug it in and check it out? A sure sign that the employees are confident in what they sell. After checking it out for fret wear and any obvious flaws, I wanted it. It was very nice and played fantastic! The price was reasonable too. Considering they have overhead and payroll to contend with the likes of eBay and Amazon. They landed me a VERY competitive price and I walked out with a super nice guitar! Alex and the entire staff were class acts and treated me like they really wanted my business. Something you don’t see much of anymore in this day and age. I know where I’m going when I need another guitar!  I would recommend anyone shopping pawn businesses and such to  check these guys out first! A++

resp.text: It's very fulfilling to hear about positive encounters at our store. Thank you for your business, hope to see you again in the future!

name: matthew meskill
text:
Do not go to that huge pistol & pawn shop before going to Family! Wow! The staff is amazing, friendly and knowledgeable. The selection is fantastic, anything you could want! The prices are super competitive if not the lowest around. I put a lot of time and research in before I made my purchase and Family Jewelry  & Loan is the real deal!

PART 2

Wouldn't let me do another review so here's part 2. Another visit another fantastic experience! Staff is knowledgeable and friendly! David & family have so many choices and options I feel like a kid in a candy store! I feel guilty taking up so much of their time, but not once have I felt rushed or heard that dreaded deep breath of hurry up and get out like you get other places. In you are looking for jewelry,  computers, tools, games, movies, guns shop here first!

resp.text: Thank you for the amazing review.  We really appreciate your business and look forward to helping you again in the future.

name: Irene Duffey
text: My Husband and I  have been doing business with family jewelry and loan every since they first opened there doors  unlike my Husband i knew absolutely nothing about a pawn shop  only on Television my first visit there i knew I had done found me a place to shop  they have a little bit of everything at very reasonable prices,oh and the Owner David is a great guy also knows how to hire  great employees. My Husband had fallen real sick we had to take a couple of items to pawn David helped us beyond belief. I recommend Family Jewelry and Loan to everyone

resp.text: Thank you guys for your return business.  We appreciate and value your business please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you guys in the future THANK YOU.

name: Ralph Cantrell
text:
This might be the best pawn shop in town. The atmosphere was several degrees better than your average pawn shop - very clean and well lit, customer friendly, and the folks running the place were very conscientious and genuinely nice. We actually felt welcomed and appreciated for just stopping by to browse. Even my wife and teenager really liked the place and they are both easily "sketched-out" by any kind of second hand store.

I was really impressed with all the good stuff for sale. All of it was very nicely displayed too. There were guns of all kinds and other hunting equipment, tools, musical instruments, high-end sunglasses, games, sports equipment, rods and reels, portable air conditioners, TVs and other electronics - you name it - and LOTS of top quality jewelry. (I'm pretty sure wifey plans to sneak back over there without me :-0 )

The prices seem fair and are clearly marked, but don't be afraid to ask for an even better deal. I was able to negotiate a great price on a particular item I had been needing for a long time but could never bring myself to purchase. Now I am glad I waited.

This place is a 5-star business for sure.

Thanks, Family Jewelry and Loan!!

resp.text: Ralph Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  We work really hard on keeping a clean, organized store.  We understand that a comfortable environment is really important now a days to make everyone feel welcome, and we strive to do this on a daily basis.  We really appreciate your business and look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Todd Zelenka (zeltod)
text:
I stopped in the store at a recommendation from a friend at church.  I was looking for a ring for my wife to celebrate our 10 years together.  I have to say that the ring I found was an EXCELLENT deal - I am not a jewelry expert and was a little uneasy about buying jewelry from a pawn shop.  I was told that the shop would stand behind the ring and wrote the details about the ring on my receipt that they would guarantee.

The next day I went to a local jewelry store to see what kind of deal I got.  Man was I surprised - I not only got a confirmation of the details of the ring were 100% correct - I was told that the ring was worth 5 times what I paid for it......I couldn't have been happier.

To know that I got a great deal on a great piece of jewelry alone would bring me back to this store.  Then add the friendly, customer centered, genuine service I received from the staff and  I will be a customer for a long time.  In fact, I came back a couple weeks later and bought a cool watch.

Make this your first or last stop and you will be glad you did.

resp.text: Thank you Todd we appreciate your business and are glad your happy with your purchase.  We pride ourselves on having the BEST jewelry prices in town.
